head.supplied: Copy. ¶ Royal Geographical Society of Australasia ¶ Queensland Chambers ¶ 18. Bridge St ¶ 24th Augt 94...

div.p: From Philip Gidley King et al.
ML MSS.853/1, letter copy book, p. 419, The Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (New South Wales Branch), Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, 'Segoe UI Symbol'; font-size: 12pt;

div.p: MS annotation possibly by the honorary secretary, John F. Mann: 'Posted on the 24 September'. The letter was enclosed with J. Mann to M, 22 September 1894. For a copy of the letter, see ML MSS.853/2, item 6, The Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (New South Wales Branch), Mitchell Library. For M's acknowledgment, see M to J. Mann, 29 September 1894. Copy.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, 'Segoe UI Symbol'; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, 'Segoe UI Symbol'; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, 'Segoe UI Symbol'; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, 'Segoe UI Symbol'; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, 'Segoe UI Symbol'; font-size: 12pt;

div.p: To Baron Sir Ferdinand Von Mueller K.C.M.G. — M.D. PhD. F.R.S. etc.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, 'Segoe UI Symbol'; font-size: 12pt;
font-family: Geneva, 'Segoe UI Symbol'; font-size: 12pt;

div.p:
Resolved. That in congratulating Baron von Mueller on the occasion of the honour recently conferred upon him by the Institute of France,
M had apparently been misled by a letter he had received from the French botanist G. A. Chatin into thinking he had been elected; see M to L. Dejardin, 5 August 1895 (in this edition as 95-08-05a) and notes thereto. He was elected a year later, on 1 July 1895. the President and Council of the Royal Geographical Society of Australasia, Sydney desire to record their appreciation of the valuable services which the Baron has rendered to the world in the cause of science; and they sincerely trust that continued health and a prolonged life may enable him to extend his researches in those branches of science the successful study of which has long since caused his name to be enrolled amongst the most eminent savants of the age —

p.style: font-family: Geneva, 'Segoe UI Symbol'; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, 'Segoe UI Symbol'; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: we have the honor to remain
